metadata.title: CVE-2023-52518 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:Bluetooth: hci_codec: Fix leaking content of local_codecs The followingmemory leak can be observed when the controller supports codecs which arestored in local_codecs list but the elements are never freed: unreferencedobject 0xffff88800221d840 (size 32): comm "kworker/u3:0", pid 36, jiffies4294898739 (age 127.060s) hex dump (first 32 bytes): f8 d3 02 03 80 88 ffff 80 d8 21 02 80 88 ff ff ..........!..... 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 0000 00 00 00 00 00 ................ backtrace: [<ffffffffb324f557>]__kmalloc+0x47/0x120 [<ffffffffb39ef37d>]hci_codec_list_add.isra.0+0x2d/0x160 [<ffffffffb39ef643>]hci_read_codec_capabilities+0x183/0x270 [<ffffffffb39ef9ab>]hci_read_supported_codecs+0x1bb/0x2d0 [<ffffffffb39f162e>]hci_read_local_codecs_sync+0x3e/0x60 [<ffffffffb39ff1b3>]hci_dev_open_sync+0x943/0x11e0 [<ffffffffb396d55d>]hci_power_on+0x10d/0x3f0 [<ffffffffb30c99b4>] process_one_work+0x404/0x800[<ffffffffb30ca134>] worker_thread+0x374/0x670 [<ffffffffb30d9108>]kthread+0x188/0x1c0 [<ffffffffb304db6b>] ret_from_fork+0x2b/0x50[<ffffffffb300206a>] ret_from_fork_asm+0x1a/0x30

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52518` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.6.0-14-generic - 6.6.0-14.14
linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-14-generic - 6.6.0-14.14
linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-14-generic-64k - 6.6.0-14.14
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-1001-aws - 6.6.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-1001-azure - 6.6.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-1001-gcp - 6.6.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 6.6.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-14-lowlatency - 6.6.0-14.14.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-14-lowlatency-64k - 6.6.0-14.14.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-1001-oracle - 6.6.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-6.7.0-1001-raspi - 6.7.0-1001.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.6.0-14.14').
linux-aws package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.6.0-1001.1').
linux-azure package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.6.0-1001.1').
linux-gcp package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.6.0-1001.1').
linux-gke package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
linux-ibm package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.6.0-1001.1').
linux-lowlatency package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.6.0-14.14.1').
linux-oracle package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.6.0-1001.1').
linux-raspi package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.7.0-1001.1').
